name: Hotel Palomar Los Angeles - Westwood - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.title: Shagadellic
reviews.text: Best place to stay in LA.
I liked the morning coffee, location and privacy. rooms are very nice and attendants are detail oriented. My favorite place away from home.
reviews.title: Nice 'Modern' Hotel

likes.disliked: — No HDTV, lack of staff professionalism

reviews.title: Ditto the below review...an excellent value!

likes.liked: — Excellent value, small but nice room, friendly service, convenient location.
likes.disliked: — Crowded lobby during wine reception, a/c was pretty noisy but worked well.

reviews.text: The Hotel Palomar is the latest location in the Kimpton Group's chain of boutique hotels. All of the distinctive Kimpton touches are there - evening wine reception, premium morning coffee, very comfortable bed, L'Occitane toiletries, great upscale restaurant on-site. The Westwood-area hotel is easily accessed on Wilshire Blvd., which is good, since most area restaurants and shops will require a drive (or at least a very long walk).
reviews.title: Some Quirks, but Overall A Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything looked new, which makes sense as the hotel was extensively renovated and has only been open as a Palomar for three months. The staff seemed friendly and eager, but unpolished (I generally don't expect to hear the terms 'cool' and 'awesome' being used by the staff during check-in). The rooms seemed somewhat smaller than usual, but were clean, and included both very nice details (42" flat panel television, chaise lounge, ample lighting with touch controls) and disappointing shortcuts (no HD on the TV, cheapish furniture).
reviews.title: A nice hotel

reviews.text: What a terrible experience! New paint, carpets and a few pieces of cool furniture can't disguise the inherent shortcomings of this renovated hotel. (I am told it used to be a Doubetree, and that's the level it remains at). The rooms are too small, the AC is so loud you want to cover your ears the whole time you are in the room, and the walls are so thin that even if you turn yours off you'll hear your neighbor's AC (not to mention their bathroom visits). And don't get me started on the pool: tucked away in what feels like an alley behind the hotel (between the hotel's dumpster and the washing facility), with a grand total of five sunbathing chairs -- try fighting for one on a Saturday afternoon - and a bunch of shared couches. Half the equipment in the fitness center fails to work properly. True, the staff are friendly, but this "boutique" hotel is a joke.
reviews.title: A disappointment

reviews.text: We loved this hotel, beautiful rooms, nice staff, good location close to UCLA. Westwood Village very cool and close. Staff was very nice and ready to please. Would definitely go back and recommend. We had booked the grand opening rate of $229 and for an additional $100 got an amazing suite. Really liked it. In the mornings they offer free coffee and evenings a free wine hour. That right there is a big savings.
reviews.title: Had a great stay

reviews.text: We stayed in a king bed suite for 5 nights. after reading the reviews on trip advisor. What a Nightmare. The hotel is located at the center of everything, the Rooms are okay but the noise is terrible . None of us could sleep all night . The AC was too loud and we were given the top floor so the room was very hot and we were not able to use the AC because of the noise,. The Road noise was the worst, every single second we were able to here the traffic. It is not worth the money. The front desk Staff were very indifferent to our problem. Please don't stay in this hotel
reviews.title: Terrible
way too expensive for what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: beware, the expense does not end with the room charge!
reviews.title: We can't wait to stay again!

reviews.text: for a famiy of 4 to sightsee in la, we booked this hotel because of its central location. my husband is a frequent business traveler LA and says that downtown is not safe at night.
reviews.title: Westwood Winner

likes.liked: — Free happy hours, internet access, and iPod alarm clock

reviews.text: we balked a little at spending more than $300, but figured we'd have this SUPER room. for the price we got a average sized room with artsy furniture. the room was not ready when we arrived and the toilet would not work unless you took off the top of the tank to manually flush it.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel IF You Get The Right Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just left the hotel: what a wonderful experience!!! The hotel is brand new and the staff is incredibly helpful. Our room, a king deluxe, was decorated with design furniture and in the wardrobe we found bathrobes (Roberto Cavalli style). In the lobby, you can have a cup of coffee in the morning and a glass of wine in the evening. The location is also great: Westwood is quiet, but near all the attractions. Don't forget to plan a visit to the Getty Musuem: the view is stunning!!!
reviews.title: SIMPLY THE BEST...

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for my last night before flying home from Los Angeles. I stayed at that Beverly Hills Hotel and Shutters on the Beach before the Palomar/Westwood. Although the Beverly Hills hotel is in a different catagory...the Palomar was an excellent value and a fine choice for tourists and business people alike.
reviews.title: Great Hotel....Great Value!

likes.disliked: — Room air conditioner was a bit loud....but worked well.

reviews.text: I booked the hotel at 189 on a AAA rate which was a great price for a great LA location (Wilshire Blvd). The hotel is older and recently renovated. Check in was first rate, the valet was super friendly and smiling and they knew my name by the time I approached the front desk. The staff were really friendly and welcoming.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel / Friendly Staff

reviews.text: My room was a typical sized chain hotel layout but the renovations and decor were really edgy and super comfortable. Great linens, great big screen television, desk, FREE wifi, and a cool bathroom with stylish sink/ammenities.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Of note, the hotel offers a free wine hour in the evening which was well attended, the lobby is eclectic with a fireplace, very comfortable. Hotel security was visable and reassuring.
reviews.title: Not so great

description: Hotel Palomar Los Angeles – Westwood is a stunner of a boutique hotel in Los Angeles’ most vibrantly beautiful neighborhood. Located on Wilshire Boulevard’s Golden Mile, this stylish “Art in Motion” hotel is steps from UCLA, Westwood Village, Rodeo Drive and Beverly Hills. The luxurious guestrooms feature sweeping city views and modern artistic décor. Blvd 16 offers a stylish and comfortable setting for guests to enjoy fresh and flavorful cuisine using local sustainable products.
